title: House introduces NASA reauthorization act
summary: A bipartisan NASA act would formally authorize several ongoing programs while directing the agency to provide reports on topics ranging from Space Launch System usage to servicing of the Hubble Space Telescope.

title: Ariane 6 inaugural flight press conference
summary: Replay of the press conference held in Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana with ESA, ArianeGroup, CNES and Arianespace representatives providing updates on the first mission of Ariane 6.

title: Ariane 6 first launch
summary: Europe’s new rocket Ariane 6 powered Europe into space taking with it a varied selection of experiments, satellites, payload deployers and reentry demonstrations that represent thousands across Europe, from students to industry and experienced space actors.

title: The first Ariane 6 rocket soars to the sky
summary: The first Ariane 6 rocket soars to the sky

title: Ariane 6 Lifts Off, But Second Stage Anomaly Spoils the Day
summary: Europe’s new Ariane 6 rocket lifted off this afternoon for the first time. Four years late and a year after the final Ariane 5 took flight, European space officials initially […]

title: Japanese venture seeks to develop commercial space station module
summary: A Japanese conglomerate has established a new subsidiary seeking to develop a module that could be installed on future commercial space stations.

title: Europe's new Ariane 6 rocket powers into space
summary: Europe's new heavy-lift rocket, Ariane 6, made its inaugural flight from Europe's Spaceport in French Guiana at 16:00  local time on 9 July (20:00 BST, 21:00 CEST).

title: Ariane 6 first liftoff
summary: Europe’s new rocket Ariane 6 powered Europe into space taking with it a varied selection of experiments, satellites, payload deployers and reentry demonstrations that represent thousands across Europe, from students to industry and experienced space actors.

title: Astroscale spacecraft continues inspection of upper stage
summary: An Astroscale spacecraft is continuing to inspect a Japanese upper stage left in low Earth orbit while demonstrating it can do so safely.
